009package imagingbook.common.geometry.shape;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Primitive2d;
015
016/**
017 * Used to check if AWT shapes produced by {@link ShapeProducer#getShape()}
018 * match the underlying curve ({@link Primitive2d}). This is mainly used to test
019 * if generated shapes (to be drawn to the screen) are sufficiently accurate.
020 * 
021 * @see ShapeProducer
022 * @see Primitive2d
023 */
024public class ShapeChecker {
025
026        private final double tolerance;
027        
028        /**
029         * Constructor.
030         * 
031         * @param tolerance maximum deviation between curve and shape
032         */
033        public ShapeChecker(double tolerance) {
034                this.tolerance = tolerance;
035        }
036        
037        /**
038         * Constructor.
039         */
040        public ShapeChecker() {
041                this(0.5);
042        }
043        
044        /**
045         * Checks if all points of the specified AWT {@link Shape} are sufficiently
046         * close to the {@link Primitive2d} instance specified in the constructor.
047         * This is typically used to test if a shape produced
048         * by {@link ShapeProducer#getShape()} coincides with this curve.
049         * Only the discrete sample points produced by {@link ShapePointIterator}
050         * are checked, not the points on connecting polygon segments. 
051         * Typical usage example:
052         * <pre>
053         * GeometricCircle circle = ... ; // implements ShapeProducer and Curve2d
054         * Shape shape = circle.getShape();
055         * boolean ok = new ShapeChecker().checkShape(circle, shape);</pre>
056         * 
057         * @param curve a {@link Primitive2d} instance
058         * @param shape the AWT shape to check
059         * @return true if all points of the shape are closer to the curve than tolerance
060         */
061        public boolean check(Primitive2d curve, Shape shape) {
062                ShapePointIterator iter = new ShapePointIterator(shape, 0.5 * tolerance);
063                boolean result = true;
064                while(iter.hasNext()) {
065                        Pnt2d p = iter.next();
066                        if (curve.getDistance(p) > tolerance) {
067                                result = false;
068                                break;
069                        }
070                }
071                return result;
072        }
073
074}
